environment_variables.description: Database user name. Can be optional depending on the database connection type.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_DATABASE_USER

environment_variables.description: Database user password. Can be optional depending on the database connection type.

environment_variables.description: JDBC URL for database connection. If this is provided, the server, host, port and database are not used.

environment_variables.description: SchemaCrawler database plugin, for example, 'sqlserver' or 'sqlite'. Used only if the JDBC URL is not provided.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_SERVER

environment_variables.description: Database host. Defaults to localhost. Used only if the JDBC URL is not provided.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_HOST

environment_variables.description: Database port. Defaults to the default port for the server type. Used only if the JDBC URL is not provided.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_PORT

environment_variables.description: Database to connect to (optional). Used only if the JDBC URL is not provided.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_DATABASE

environment_variables.description: How much database metadata to retrieve. Values are 'minimum', 'standard', 'detailed' or 'maximum'.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_INFO_LEVEL

environment_variables.description: Logging verbosity level. Values are 'SEVERE', 'WARNING', 'INFO', 'CONFIG', or 'FINE'.
environment_variables.name: SCHCRWLR_LOG_LEVEL

environment_variables.description: Comma-separated list of tool sets to load

servers.description: MCP server for Atlassian Jira Data Center - search, view, and create issues

environment_variables.description: Jira host domain (e.g. your-instance.atlassian.net)
environment_variables.name: JIRA_HOST

environment_variables.description: Jira API base path (alternative to JIRA_HOST)
environment_variables.name: JIRA_API_BASE_PATH

environment_variables.description: Jira Personal Access Token or API token
environment_variables.name: JIRA_API_TOKEN

package_arguments.name: --transport

headers.name: X-API-Key

package_arguments.description: Use HTTP transport type for MCP server
package_arguments.name: --transport
